message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nystatin acts by binding to ergosterol in the fungal cell membrane, leading to membrane disruption and subsequent death of the fungus. If the isolate has reduced ergosterol content in the cell membrane, it will be resistant to the action of nystatin even at high concentrations. Mutations in the β-glucan gene, alteration in squalene epoxidase binding site or dysfunction of cytochrome P-450 enzymes are not related to nystatin resistance.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nystatin is an antifungal drug that works by binding to ergosterol in the fungal cell membrane, leading to membrane disruption and fungal death. Reduced ergosterol content in the cell membrane would make the fungus resistant to the drug. Mutations of the β-glucan gene and altered binding sites of squalene epoxidase would affect the synthesis of cell wall and membrane, respectively, but not directly affect the target of nystatin. Expression of dysfunctional cytochrome P-450 enzymes is not relevant to the mechanism of action of nystatin.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nystatin works by binding to ergosterol in the fungal cell membrane and disrupting its integrity. Resistance to nystatin can occur due to reduced ergosterol content in the membrane, which can prevent binding of the drug. Therefore, option A is the most likely explanation for the finding. Option B refers to the mechanism of action of echinocandins, not nystatin. Option C is a mechanism of resistance to azoles, not nystatin. Option D is not a known mechanism of resistance to nystatin.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nystatin works by binding to ergosterol, a component of fungal cell membranes. Therefore, a reduced ergosterol content in the cell membrane would make the fungi resistant to nystatin. Options B, C, and D are not related to the mode of action of nystatin.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nystatin works by binding to ergosterol in the fungal cell membrane, leading to membrane permeability and ultimately cell death. If the fungal isolate has reduced ergosterol content, it would be less susceptible to the effects of nystatin, as we see in this scenario. Mutations in the β-glucan gene, altered binding sites of squalene epoxidase, or dysfunctional cytochrome P-450 enzymes are not related to nystatin susceptibility.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nystatin acts by binding to ergosterol in the cell membrane of fungi, causing membrane permeability and subsequent death of the fungus. If the isolate has reduced ergosterol content in its cell membrane, it would be resistant to nystatin. Mutations in the β-glucan gene, altered binding sites of squalene epoxidase, and expression of dysfunctional cytochrome P-450 enzymes are not known to cause resistance to nystatin.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nystatin works by binding to ergosterol, a component of fungal cell membranes, and disrupting membrane function. If the isolate has reduced ergosterol content in its cell membrane, it would be resistant to nystatin treatment. The other options are not directly related to nystatin's mechanism of action.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nystatin inhibits fungal growth by binding to ergosterol in the cell membrane. If an organism has decreased ergosterol content in the cell membrane, it will be less susceptible to the effects of nystatin. Therefore, reduced ergosterol content in the cell membrane is the most likely explanation for this finding.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nystatin targets the cell membrane of fungi and binds to ergosterol, causing membrane disruption and death. Resistance can develop due to reduced ergosterol content in the cell membrane, making the fungus less susceptible to nystatin. Mutations of the β-glucan gene, altered binding sites of squalene epoxidase, and dysfunctional cytochrome P-450 enzymes are mechanisms of resistance to other antifungal agents.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nystatin is a fungicidal agent that binds to ergosterol in fungal cell membranes, causing cell death. If there is reduced ergosterol content in the cell membrane, the drug will not be effective and the fungus will continue to grow even at high concentrations of the drug. Therefore, option (A) is the correct answer. Mutations in the β-glucan gene are associated with resistance to echinocandins, not nystatin. Squalene epoxidase is a target of terbinafine, not nystatin. Dysfunctional cytochrome P-450 enzymes can lead to resistance to azoles, not nystatin.
